revised_title: Tapeta Lucida in the Eyes of Goatsuckers: A Study on Caprimulgidae
tldr: This study examines the presence of a tapetum lucidum in the eyes of goatsuckers (Caprimulgidae) and discovers a white, diffusely reflecting tapetum in the pigment epithelium of their eyes. The tapetum is a lipid type, and its structure allows for back scattering, contributing to the eyeshine observed in these nocturnal birds.
